title: Bought it for its higher levels of Phosphorus/Zinc
description:
I hove used Mobil 1 in my truck for the last 2-3 years. Prior I had been using their extended 5w-30 
 but this year I wanted to see if it was the best for my truck (old 94 Chevy K1500 w/350 w/over 200k miles). Since my truck has the old TBI 350 with out a roller cam shaft that people say need more ZDP (zinc) in it to protect the camshaft I tried to research what Mobil one had in their offerings (Mobil 1 standard, High mileage and extended). Took a little time as Mobil doesn't list it on their site I was able to find a Mobil 1Oil Product Guide .pdf that lists all their flavors and viscosities with Phosphorus/zinc levels and if it meets any manufacturer requirements. In my case looking at 5W-30 Extended performance had 800ppm Phosphorus and 900ppm zinc, standard Mobil 1 had the same but High Mileage has 1000ppm Phosphorus and 1100ppm Zinc. Off the top of my head I did compare this to what other fully synthetic brands were offering (Valvoline, Penzoil, Castrol), but I am pretty sure this High Mileage was better! (again this is for fully synthetic, you might find matching or better levels in a blend or fully conventional oil)
This is my first go with the stuff so we shall see if it is better?
